review.title: On Generalized Rectangular Fuzzy Model for Assessment
review.abstract: The article is dedicated to the analysis of the existing models for assessment based of the fuzzy logic centroid technique. A new Generalized Rectangular Model were developed. Some generalizations of the existing models are offered.

sections.heading: INTRODUCTION
sections.text: The majority of evaluation methods commonly used in practice are traditionally based on the principles of classical, bivalent logic. However, due to the nature of human beings, there are many cases where the traditional approach is not the fully appropriate one. For example, a teacher is often unsure which particular numerical degree to assign. Fuzzy logic, by its nature of characterizing a case with multiple values, provides more comprehensive and richer resources for such cases. General facts about fuzzy sets can be found in the book [1]. Within the last decade, some useful applications based on the fuzzy centroid method (see for example [2]) have been developed by the author and his collaborators in [3-11] and then implemented in some recent research (see for example [12-14]). In the current article, we construct a new Generalized Rectangular Model (GRM) for evaluation and discuss its place among other previously developed models (Rectangular Model, Triangular Model and Trapezoidal Model).

metadata.abstractText: The author constructs a new Generalized Rectangular Model (GRM) for assessment and discusses its place among other previously developed models (the Rectangular Model, Triangular Model, and Trapezoidal Model). More importantly, a generalized approach unifying all these models and criteria for their applications to assessment were also developed. This generalizes and significantly simplifies the process of the listed models’ implementation. A concrete example and supporting analysis based on the application of the fuzzy models to learning assessment are given.
